reasoning: Deuteranopia (green cone deficiency) accounts for approximately 50% of red-green color blindness cases. Prevalence ~1% in males (1000/100k), 0.01% in females (10/100k); weighted average ~2500/100k.
source: Neitz J & Neitz M. (2011). The genetics of normal and defective color vision. J Ophthalmol. 2011:321639
